Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the extent to which spending under Obama has "accelerated at a pace without precedent in recent history" or has risen "slower than at any time in nearly 60 years."
Understate: The claim may be understating the actual increase in federal spending under Obama by stating that it has risen "slower than at any time in nearly 60 years."
Lack enough support: The claim may lack sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that spending under Obama has either accelerated or risen slower than in previous years.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Mitt Romney's statement about spending under Obama is incorrect, without providing evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the patterns in federal spending under Obama or provide a comprehensive analysis of the factors influencing spending trends.
